info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued April 13 at 6:55PM MDT by NWS GreatFalls
info.description: ...A few weak thunderstorms will impact portions of eastern Pondera, southwestern Liberty, central Toole, east central Teton, west central Chouteau and north central Cascade Counties through 745 PM MDT... At 652 PM MDT, Doppler radar was tracking rain and snow showers with a few embedded weak thunderstorms along a line extending from 6 miles south of Kevin to 10 miles east of Dutton. These storms were nearly stationary. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 30 mph and pea size hail or graupel. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs that still have snow on them. Driving may become briefly difficult due to reduced visibility in heavier snow showers. Locations impacted include... Shelby, Kevin, Ferdig, Dunkirk, Oilmont and Ledger. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...30 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building.
